intro: Zeuxine chenkangensis, commonly known as the Chenkang false dragonhead, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
